clinical_study.brief_title: Reduce Stress Associated With Needle Aspiration, in Voluntary and Replacement Blood Donors
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Virtual Reality in Blood Donors, an Innovative Tool

lead_sponsor.agency: Center for Blood and Tissues IV and V Region, Chile

clinical_study.source: Center for Blood and Tissues IV and V Region, Chile

brief_summary.textblock:
Reduce stress associated with needle aspiration, in voluntary and replacement blood donors.
This study has not been completed.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the study is to investigate the effectiveness of Virtual Reality (as a form of distraction) to reduce the stress associated with extraction needle puncture in the volunteer blood donors and reposition of Fixed Collection of the Valparaiso Blood Center, Of the Valparaíso San Antonio Health Service.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Allocation of two groups (Study and Control)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once finalized the donation that should last a maximum of 15 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate. Measurement with automatic equipment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before donating, after the puncture and after the extraction of the needle.Maximum duration of the procedure, 15 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Measure for the perception of stress

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood pressure. Measurement with automatic equipment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before donating, after the puncture and after the extraction of the needle.Maximum duration of the procedure, 15 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Measure for the perception of stress

arm_group.description: The objective is to apply a technique, using virtual reality lenses, with relaxing audio-visual contents of no more than ten minutes, to reduce stress before and during the blood donation process and to respond to the level of pain perceived during donation, either post-puncture and withdrawal of the needle
The objective is to respond to the level of pain perceived during donation, either post-puncture and withdrawal of the needle, without virtual reality support

intervention.intervention_name: Use of virtual reality lenses, with relaxing audio-visual contents
intervention.description: Use of virtual reality lenses (and audio) as a distraction for the blood donor patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to understand and / or visualize the numerical scale of pain
- Spanish spoken
- Greater than 50 Kilograms of weight
- Blood hemoglobin: Greater than 12.5 g% in women and greater than 13.5 g% in men
- Have been accepted as a blood donor.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to understand and / or visualize the numerical scale of pain
- Does not speak Spanish
- Less than 50 Kilograms
- Blood hemoglobin: Less than 12.5 g% in women and less than 13.5 g% in men.
- Have been rejected as a blood donor.
